data.title: JAWS Fan? Get Up Close & Personal With Co-Writer Carl Gottlieb
data.meta_description: Screenwriter Fantasy Camp brings co-writer of JAWS, Carl Gottlieb together with participants in a virtual event to discuss craft, career and behind the scenes stories from his legendary films. This event is on Saturday & Sunday, January 22nd & 23rd.
data.text:
Go behind the scenes of JAWS. A new upcoming virtual event offers the opportunity to get up close and personal with co-writer of the movie.

Creative Convergence and Hollywood's Finest have come to together to present Screenwriter Fantasy Camp. This program brings A-List Screenwriters with participants on a conference line to discuss their craft, careers and behind the scenes stories from legendary films. The premiere Screenwriting Fantasy Camp virtual event is Saturday and Sunday, January 22nd & 23rd with special guest Carl Gottlieb.

Gordon Meyer of Hollywood's Finest hosts and facilitates a Q&A of both FAQs and participant questions. As a virtual event, anyone can participate from home on their phone. For anyone who is interested in Hollywood and the art and craft of storytelling this is a great opportunity to make the connection.

Carl Gottlieb is best known as the co-writer of Jaws and author of the Jaws Log. He also co-wrote The Jerk and wrote and directed the cult classic Cavemen. He'll be taking participants behind the behind the screens. Together they can get a front row seat to what it means to be an A-List Hollywood screenwriter.

Creative Convergence is a Los Angeles based media, marketing & management company. Company and client credits include projects for Disney Channel, Lifetime, Sci-Fi, Starz, MTV, Cartoon Network, CBS/Paramount, ABC, New Line Cinema, Fox, Sony and Paramount. The company regularly programs and facilitates entertainment & media related events. They also offer the teleseminar programs Screenwriting Career Intensive & Media Brand Workshop for emerging writers & content creators.

Previous Hollywood's Finest guests at live events in Los Angeles have included: Oliver Stone, Jerry Bruckheimer, Pierce Brosnon, George Clooney, Jeffrey Katzenberg, Drew Barrymore, Sidney Sheldon, Ray Bradbury, David Franzoni, James Cameron, Bob Gale, Antoine Fuqua, Gary Sinese, Daniel Handler and Lloyd & Sherwood Schwartz, among others.

Screenwriter Fantasy Camp is held over two-days and can be accessed over the phone for two hours on Saturday and again for two hours on Sunday. Participants will also have access to an online forum and additional supplementary materials including MP3 and video from the sessions. A portion of proceeds goes to support The Writers' Guild Foundation. The cost is $197 and event registration is at: http://screenwriterfantasycamp-carlgottlieb.eventbrite.com/.
